page.description: Parse the SQLStatement passed (or the value previously set into the SQLStatement property).
page.original:
SQL::UpdateStatement::Parse() Syntax Result_Flag as L = .Parse( [ SQL_Statement as C ] ) Argument Description Result_Flag TRUE (.T.) if the operation was successful; otherwise FALSE (.F.). A SQL::UpdateStatement object. SQL_Statement Optional. A Portable SQL statement.
Description The .Parse() method parses the SQL_Statement string (or the value previously set into the SQL::UpdateStatement.SQLStatement property). Example dim conn as SQL::Connection dim connString as C dim upd as SQL::UpdateStatement dim sql_update as C connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v7\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" sql_update = "update customer set bill_city = 'Phoenix', bill_postal_code = '08000', bill_state_region = 'AZ' where customer_id = 1" if .not. conn.open(connString) then end end if if .not. upd.parse(sql_update) then ui_msg_box("Error", upd.callresult.text) end end if if .not. upd.execute(conn) then end end if
See Also SQL::UpdateStatement Object Limitations
